semantic_title: Congenital Conditions and Anomalies POA Assignment
section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Congenital conditions and anomalies

content.full_text: Assign 'Y' for congenital conditions and anomalies except for categories Q00-Q99, Congenital anomalies, which are on the exempt list. Congenital conditions are always considered present on admission. (Evidence: pg no: 120, L77-L80)
content.summary: Assign Y for congenital conditions except Q00-Q99 codes which are exempt from POA reporting (Evidence: pg no: 120, L77-L80)
key_concepts: Q00-Q99 exempt categories (Evidence: pg no: 120, L78-L79)
Always present on admission (Evidence: pg no: 120, L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Y for congenital conditions and anomalies except Q00-Q99 (Evidence: pg no: 120, L78-L79)
detailed_rules.explanation: Congenital conditions should receive Y indicator except for categories Q00-Q99 which are on the exempt list (Evidence: pg no: 120, L77-L79)
common_applications: Congenital conditions in other code categories

detailed_rules.rule_text: Congenital conditions are always considered present on admission (Evidence: pg no: 120, L80)
detailed_rules.explanation: By definition, congenital conditions exist from birth and are therefore always present at the time of any admission (Evidence: pg no: 120, L80)
common_applications: Any congenital condition regardless of when diagnosed

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify if condition is congenital
Step 2: Check if code is in Q00-Q99 range
Step 3: If Q00-Q99, leave POA field blank (exempt)
Step 4: If other congenital condition, assign Y
